credits.credits_text:
🎮 Game Development Team

👑 Furkan Kırat — Lead Developer, Game Design, Coding, Graphic Design
🎨 Efekan Kul — Game Design, Coding, Graphic Design
🎭 Halil Efe Çelik — Graphic Design
🛠️ Testing & QA — Furkan Kırat, Efekan Kul, Halil Efe Çelik, Enis Taşkın, Ege Eren Ceylan, Fatih Kınacı

🌟 Special Thanks
Special thanks to:
💡 Halil Efe Çelik, Enis Taşkın, Ege Eren Ceylan, Fatih Kınacı
for your invaluable support and contributions!

🔧 Development Tools & Resources
🧩 Unity — Game Engine & Development Platform
🗂️ GitHub — Version Control
🛠️ Rider & Visual Studio — Coding IDEs

❤️ A Special Thanks to Our Players
We are deeply grateful to all players who contributed feedback and helped shape the game experience. Your support means the world to us!

You are free to use, copy, modify, and distribute this game, even for commercial purposes, under the terms of the license.

© 2025 KankanGames. All rights reserved. (TR)

role_book.rules_text:
Game Rules and Flow

1. Night Phase:
The game begins at night, and each player, in turn, takes the device to check their role.
Each player performs their assigned task according to their role and then passes the device to the next player.
The night phase ends once all players have used their abilities.

2. Day Phase:
In the day, each player takes the device in turn to see the results of the task performed by their role during the night.

After all players have reviewed their results, the device is returned to the first player, and the voting phase begins.

3. Voting Phase:
Before voting, players discuss and exchange ideas based on the information they gathered during the night. 
The voting is open, and each player cast their vote and pass the device to next player.
The player who receives more than half of the votes is eliminated.
After voting is complete, the game transitions back to the night phase, and this cycle continues.

Teams and Objectives

Folk:
Their goal is to ensure that, by the end of the game, all surviving players belong only to the Folk team.

Corrupt:
Their goal is to ensure that, by the end of the game, all surviving players belong only to the Corrupt team.

Neutral:
Neutral players have unique win conditions or tasks specific to their roles. Their goal is to achieve their individual objectives. For more information check the role guide. (TR)

hints.tooltip_username: Enter your username. It will be used to identify you in the game. (TR)
hints.tooltip_language: Select your preferred language for the game interface. (TR)
hints.tooltip_host_game: Create a game lobby and wait for players to join. All players must be on the same local network. (TR)
hints.tooltip_join_game: Join an existing game lobby. Make sure you are connected to the same local network as the host. (TR)
hints.tooltip_add_player: Add a new player to the game. (TR)
hints.tooltip_remove_player: Removes the selected player from the game. (TR)
hints.tooltip_start_game: Start the game when all players are ready. The game requires at least 5 and at most 10 players. (TR)
